docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Harry Reid of Nevada and other Democrats have begun to undermine what was poised to be a sweeping bipartisan solution to several policy problems that have long vexed Congress.

headline.main: Bipartisan Deal on Health Care Issues Hits a Snag Among Senate Democrats
headline.print_headline: Bipartisan Deal on Health Care Issues Hits a Snag Among Senate Democrats

docs.abstract: Fate of bipartisan health care deal put together by Rep Nancy Pelosi and House Speaker John Boehner is uncertain, as Sen Harry Reid's objection to abortion provision may stall bill in Senate; Reid's dissent signals reversal of congressional dynamic, with Democrats waging ideological battle from disadvantaged position, tactic long used by Republicans.
docs.snippet: Senator Harry Reid of Nevada and other Democrats have begun to undermine what was poised to be a sweeping bipartisan solution to several policy problems that have long vexed Congress.

byline.original: By JENNIFER STEINHAUER and ROBERT PEAR

docs.lead_paragraph: Even as the former Florida governor positions himself as a Washington outsider, he seems to have mastered the skill of tapping into the money-raising clout of the city’s lobbyists, political operatives, lawyers and business leaders.

headline.main: Jeb Bush Returns to the Washington Fund-Raising Well
headline.print_headline: Bush Uses Well-Honed Skills in Tapping Washington’s Fund-Raising Well

docs.abstract: Former Florida governor Jeb Bush has yet to declare his candidacy in 2016 presidential race, but he is far outpacing potential Republican rivals in fundraising.
docs.snippet: Even as the former Florida governor positions himself as a Washington outsider, he seems to have mastered the skill of tapping into the money-raising clout of the city’s lobbyists, political operatives, lawyers and business leaders.

byline.contributor: Jonathan Martin contributed reporting. Kitty Bennett contributed research.

headline.main: Cruz, Critic of Health Care Law, Now Seeks to Sign Up

docs.abstract: Senator Ted Cruz helped lead an effort to shut down the government in 2013 in an attempt to defund President Obama’s health care law. Now, he is signing up for coverage under it.
docs.snippet: Senator Ted Cruz helped lead an effort to shut down the government in 2013 in an attempt to defund President Obama’s health care law. Now, he is signing up for coverage under it.

docs.lead_paragraph: Sen. Ted Cruz could soon be buying his family's health care coverage through the Affordable Care Act, a law the Republican presidential candidate has vowed to repeal should he win the White House.

docs.lead_paragraph: Kaiser Family Foundation says half the U.S. households eligible to receive help buying insurance last year under the health care overhaul will have to repay some of that aid this tax season. Blame the tricky task of predicting future income.

docs.lead_paragraph: Workers at large, export-oriented farms in the Mexican border state of Baja California have led a week of violent protests over low pay, abuses and poor conditions, threatening a harvest that supplies millions of dollars worth of tomatoes, strawberries and other crops to the United States.

docs.lead_paragraph: An extraordinary bipartisan accord between House Speaker John Boehner and Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi is letting both parties exhale as they move toward permanently ending the nagging annual threat of Medicare cuts to physicians. Yet each side is bragging about more than that.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. House of Representatives Speaker John Boehner said on Tuesday that prospects were good for passage of a permanent fix to Medicare's flawed doctor-pay formula, a move that would spare physicians from impending pay cuts.

headline.main: Medicare Doctor Pay Fix Prospects Brighten in Congress
headline.print_headline: Medicare Doctor Pay Fix Prospects Brighten in Congress
